dances.name: A Wee Journey
dances.author: Nicolas “Niols” Jeannerod
dances.kind: 32-bar reel for six couples in a six-couple longwise set

description.content: On second chord, 4th, 5th and 6th couples cross.

contents.content: All couples dance twelve hands round to the left for 6 bars.

5th couple in second place and 2nd couple in fifth place cross,
finishing in order 6, 5, 4, 3, 2, 1 with 6th, 4th and 2nd couples on
own sides facing down and 5th, 3rd and 1st couples on opposite sides
facing up.

All dance reels of six on the sidelines for 6 bars, giving right
shoulder to being, finishing in order 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, facing in.

All turn by the right halfway to finish into allemande hold, 1st, 3rd
and 5th couples facing up and 2nd, 4th and 6th couples facing down.

1st, 2nd and 3rd couples at the top and 6th, 5th and 4th couples at
the bottom dance circulating allemandes, finishing in order 3, 2, 1,
6, 5, 4 with 3rd, 1st and 5th couples on own sides.

All set. 2nd couple cross up while 3rd couple steps down; 5th couple
cross down while 4th couple steps up; 1st and 6th couples dance half
right hands across. All turn by the right and finish in order 2, 3, 6,
1, 4, 5.

description.more:
in July 2022: “This dance is written as a gift for Rachel Shankland and
George Meikle that took such good care of us during our Units 2 and 3. The
changes of direction give many opportunities for the men to flash their
underwear as the RSCDS demands for Unit 2.”

dances.name: Drawn in
dances.author: Shannon Kiernan
dances.kind: 32-bar strathspey for three couples in a four-couple longwise set

contents.content:
1st couple, giving right hands, dance a half figure of eight around 2nd
couple. 1st man giving left hand to 2nd woman, and 1st woman giving
right hand to 2nd man, turn once round.
1st couple dance in and cast off to second place.

1st couple, giving both hands, turn once and a half, while 2nd and 3rd
couples chase clockwise halfway.

1st couple, giving right shoulder to third corner positions, dance reels
of three on the sides with 3rd and 2nd couples, finishing with 1st
couple passing left shoulder to finish facing first corner positions.

1st couple dance corner pass and turn with first corner positions,
corners turning with both hands halfway and, pulling back right
shoulders, dance out to the opposite corner position. 1st couple,
passing right shoulders, repeat with second corner positions.

dances.name: Et voilà !
dances.author: Violaine Eysseric
dances.kind: Medley of 40-bar strathspey and 40-bar reel for four trios in a square set

contents.content:
The persons in the middle of all trios dance left hands accross in the
middle of the square and right hands accross back to original place
while the other persons dance eight hands round to the left and back.

1st and 3rd trios dance a reel of four accross the set. In each trio,
the person in the middle dances in tandem with the person on their
right; the person in the middle has the lead to start, and the lead
changes halfway in the reel. The tandems pass left shoulder to begin.

All trios dance anti-clockwise one place, finishing facing inside the
square.

All trios dance »modified set and link for three«: in each trio, the
three persons set; the person on the left dances in to finish facing
out in the person on the right's position; the person in the middle
and the person on the right cast off one place to finish in promenade
hold in the person on the left and the person in the middle's
positions.

All dance “Schiehallion reels” all round; the persons in promenade
hold sticking together as one unit.

description.text:
Repeat as strathspey and then as reel, twice. All trios progress by one
side of the square each time through as persons in trio get reordered: the
persons on the left, in the middle and on the right becoming the persons
on the right, on the left and in the middle respectively.

description.more:
during the teaching certificate class in weeks 1 and 2 of Summer School
2022 as a gift for Rachel Shankland and George Meikle: “The candidates
devised dances and created ‘The Doonhamers' Book’. This dance is for
twelve dancers as there were twelve of us; it also uses a lot of
formations included in the dances of Unit 2 – even if not always in the
usual way!”

dances.name: La Ville Lumière
dances.author: Nicolas “Niols” Jeannerod
dances.kind: 32-bar reel for four couples in a four-couple longwise set

contents.content:
1st couple set and cast off one place as 4th couple set and cast up
one place. 2nd couple step up and 3rd couple step down on bars 3-4.

1st and 4th couples dance right hands across to finish facing third
corners, that is, 1st man facing 2nd man with 4th man behind him and
4th woman facing 3rd woman with 1st woman behind her.

“Dolphin corners pass & turn”: 1st man followed by 4th man and 4th
woman followed by 1st woman pass third corners by the right and change
lead; corners dance in and turn right hand back to place as 4th man
followed by 1st man and 1st woman followed by 4th woman dance in and
pass right shoulders to face fourth corners. Repeat with fourth
corners to finish 1st and 4th couples in the middle of the set with
both hands joined with partner.
1st and 4th couple dance a poussette to finish in the order 2, 4, 1, 3.
All 4 couples dance eight hands round and back.

dances.name: One Blue Cloud in the Grey Sky
dances.author: Claire Cunin & Nicolas “Niols” Jeannerod
dances.kind: 40-bar reel for three couples in a three-couple longwise set

contents.content:
1st couple set, cast off one place and dance a half figure of eight
around 2nd couple. 2nd couple step up on bars 3-4.

1st couple set, dance a half figure of eight around 3rd couple and set
advancing to finish facing first corners.

1st couple dance corner pass and turn with their first corners and
repeat with their second, third and fourth corners, finishing on their
own sides in second position.

1st couple set, cast off one place. 3rd couple step up on bars 35-36.
1st couple turn right hand in four bars.

description.more:
in May 2018. This dance is a three-couple version of “Two Blue Clouds in
the Grey Sky”.

dances.name: Praha Matka Měst
dances.author: Nicolas “Niols” Jeannerod
dances.kind: Medley of 16-bar strathspey and 16-bar reel for three couples in a three-couple longwise set

description.content: On second chord, 2nd and 3rd couples cross.

contents.content:
1st couple set advancing and turn both hands, dance down the middle
and turn halfway with both hands to face down in Promenade hold. 2nd
couple step up on bars 5-6. 2nd and 3rd couples join in on bar 8.

2nd, 1st and 3rd couples dance an Allemande down the dance. On bars
15-16, 1st couple stays in the middle and set advancing to face first
corners in third corner position.

1st couple dance corners pass and turn and cast away: Same as corners
pass and turn, except that corners turn halfway right hand and cast
away to opposite positions. On bars 23-24, 1st couple slows down to
finish in the middle on own sides in Poussette hold; 3rd man curves to
stay in the middle on own side; 3rd woman joins in in Poussette hold.

1st and 3rd couples dance Poussette and petronella: Same five first
bars as the Poussette. On bar 6, 3rd and 1st couples dance a quarter.
On bars 7-8, 3rd and 1st couples dance a petronella turn to opposite
lines, finishing with 2nd couple in first position, and 3rd and 1st
couples improper in second and third position.

dances.name: The Mall in St. James’s Park
dances.author: Nicolas “Niols” Jeannerod
dances.kind: 32-bar strathspey for three couples in a three-couple longwise set

contents.content:
1st couple set, cross right hand, cast off one place, advance in the
middle and pull right shoulder to face first corners. 2nd couple step
up on bars 3-4.

1st couple turns first corners both hands, pass each other right
shoulder, turn second corners both hands and pass each other right
shoulder to finish on own sides.

2nd, 1st and 3rd couples dance parallel reels of three in six bars on
the lines, 1st man giving left shoulder to 3rd man and 1st woman
giving right shoulder to 3rd woman. On bars 23-24, 1st and 3rd men
exchange place left shoulder while 1st and 3rd women exchange place
right shoulder.
3rd and 1st couples dance the Poussette.

description.more:
in 2018. The name was suggested by Christophe Schuwey in reference to the
painting of the same name by Thomas Gainsborough.

dances.name: The Reel of the 51st Confusion
dances.author: Anne Lanvin, Corentin Lefèvre, Isabelle Herlant, Louise Baltera, Nicolas “Niols” Jeannerod & Victor Lanvin
dances.kind: 32-bar reel for three couples in a three-couple longwise set

contents.content:
1st couple set, cast off two places and lead up, finishing back to
back facing first corners. 2nd couple step up on bars 3-4.

1st couple set to first corners and turn with right hand halfway with
them. first corners give left hands in the middle and 1st couple and
first corners balance in line; first corners turn with left hand one
and a quarter times to end up back to back facing second corners.

Repeat with first and second corners. At the last left-hand turn,
finish on the lines with 1st, 2nd and 3rd women improper in 1st, 2nd
and 3rd position and 2nd, 3rd and 1st men improper in 1st, 2nd and 3rd
position.
All dance six hands round and back.

description.deviser:
Anne Lanvin, Corentin Lefèvre, Isabelle Herlant, Louise Baltera, Nicolas
“Niols” Jeannerod and Victor Lanvin
description.more:
on August 8th, 2021. This dance is a variation on one of the most popular
Scottish country dances, “The Reel of the 51st Division”.

description.content:
Remember the person that is at the left of your partner from your point of
view: First, third and fifth times, you will start dancing with your
partner on your original lines; Second, fourth and sixth times, you will
start dancing with that other person on the opposite lines.

description.more:
Alternatively, one can use one of the tunes for “The Reel of the 51st
Division”: “The Drunken Piper”, by Alex McLeod.

dances.name: Two Blue Clouds in the Grey Sky
dances.author: Claire Cunin & Nicolas “Niols” Jeannerod
dances.kind: 40-bar reel for five couples in a five-couple longwise set

contents.content:
1st and 3rd couples set, cast off one place and dance a half figure of
eight around 2nd and 4th couples. 2nd and 4th couples step up on bars
3-4.

1st and 3rd couples set, dance a half figure of eight around 4th and
5th couples and set advancing to finish facing first corners, 4th
woman and 2nd man for 1st couple, 5th woman and 4th man for 3rd
couple.

1st and 3rd couples dance corner pass and turn with their first
corners and repeat with their second, third and fourth corners,
finishing on their own sides in second and fourth positions.

1st and 3rd couples set, cast off one place. 4th and 5th couples step
up on bars 35-36. 1st and 3rd couples turn right hand in four bars.

description.more:
in May 2018. There exists a three-couple version of this dance, named “One
Blue Cloud in the Grey Sky”.
